Description: Top navigation bar with title and actions
Do: Use SliverAppBar for collapsible behavior. Add semantic title. Keep actions ≤ 3.
Don't: Don't overflow with too many action icons. Avoid hardcoding color.
Flutter Code Pattern: AppBar(title: Text('Title', style: theme.textTheme.titleLarge), backgroundColor: cs.surface)

Do: Use NavigationBar (M3) with 3-5 destinations. Show selected icon variation.
Don't: Don't use BottomNavigationBar — it's deprecated in M3. Don't use more than 5 tabs.

Do: Use M3 Card with elevation 0 + tonal fill. Round corners 12-16px.
Don't: Don't nest cards. Don't hardcode card background colors.

Do: Use ListTile for standard lists. Add semantics. Support swipe-to-action with Dismissible.
Don't: Don't build custom row widgets when ListTile covers your needs.
Flutter Code Pattern: ListTile(leading: Icon(...), title: Text(...), trailing: Icon(Icons.chevron_right))

Description: Image with overlay text and action
Do: Use CachedNetworkImage. Add Hero for transitions. Include semantic label.
Don't: Don't use Image.network directly. Don't forget error/loading states.

Do: Use M3 SearchBar for Android. Use CupertinoSearchTextField for iOS. Add debounce (300ms).
Don't: Don't call API on every keystroke. Don't forget clear button.

Do: Use Form + GlobalKey<FormState>. Add validator. Set keyboardType and textInputAction.
Don't: Don't use TextField outside Form if validation needed. Don't hardcode colors.

Do: Use FilledButton for primary actions. Keep label short (2-3 words). Show loading state.
Don't: Don't use ElevatedButton as primary in M3. Don't show multiple primary buttons.

Do: Use OutlinedButton for secondary. TextButton for tertiary/destructive.
Don't: Don't make secondary buttons the same visual weight as primary.

Description: Floating action button for primary action
Do: One FAB per screen. Use extended FAB with label for clarity.
Don't: Don't use multiple FABs. Don't obscure content with FAB that never hides.

Do: Use Wrap to lay out chips. Use FilterChip for multiselect filters.
Don't: Don't use chips for navigation. Don't make chips too small (< 32px height).
Flutter Code Pattern: Wrap(spacing: 8, children: items.map((e) => FilterChip(label: Text(e), selected: ...)).toList())

Do: Use AlertDialog for 1-2 actions. Use fullscreen dialog for complex forms.
Don't: Don't abuse dialogs for simple toasts. Don't have more than 2 actions.

Do: Use isScrollControlled: true. Add drag handle. Use DraggableScrollableSheet for tall sheets.
Don't: Don't put too much content in a non-scrollable sheet.

Do: Use floating snackbar (SnackBarBehavior.floating). Limit to 1-2 lines. Include action if needed.
Don't: Don't use snackbar for critical errors — use dialog instead.

Do: Show initials as fallback when image fails. Use cached image.
Don't: Don't forget fallback state when no image is available.
Flutter Code Pattern: CircleAvatar(radius: 24, backgroundImage: CachedNetworkImageProvider(url), child: url == null ? Text(initials) : null)

Do: Use shimmer for list/grid loading. Use adaptive indicator for spinners.
Don't: Don't show empty space while loading. Don't block entire UI.
Flutter Code Pattern: Shimmer.fromColors(baseColor: grey300 highlightColor: grey100 child: ListTile(...))

Do: Show icon + title + subtitle + action button. Use contextual empty state.
Don't: Don't show just plain text. Don't omit a recovery action.
Flutter Code Pattern: Center(child: Column(children: [Icon(Icons.inbox, size: 80), Text('No items'), FilledButton(...)]))

Do: Show what went wrong and a retry button. Use error icon.
Don't: Don't show technical error codes to users. Don't omit retry option.
Flutter Code Pattern: ErrorStateWidget(icon: Icons.cloud_off, title: 'Connection error', onRetry: () => ref.refresh(provider))

Description: Show count or status on icon
Do: Use M3 Badge. Keep count clipped at 99+. Position on icon.
Don't: Don't show badge with 0 count. Don't use for non-numeric status.
Flutter Code Pattern: Badge(label: Text('$count'), isLabelVisible: count > 0, child: Icon(Icons.notifications))

Description: Refresh list content by pulling down
Do: Use .adaptive for platform-appropriate indicator. Always await the refresh future.
Don't: Don't use non-adaptive RefreshIndicator on iOS.
